alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Eastern Black Range Foothills; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Gila Foothills, Mimbres Valley; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 10 at 1:54PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico and southwest New Mexico, including northern Grant, western Sierra, and northeastern Otero Counties. This includes the Sacramento Mountains, Black Range, Mimbres Valley and Gila National Wilderness. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Runoff from mountain burn scars may result in debris flows. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
